decks.notes: The main strategy of this Merfolk aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive creature-based assault. By utilizing powerful Merfolk lords like Lord of Atlantis and Merrow Reejerey, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce helps to protect the Merfolk creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also benefits from the mana acceleration provided by Aether Vial and includes utility lands like Mutavault and Wasteland to further enhance its aggressive strategy.

This Bant Aggro deck focuses on efficiently ramping up mana with cards like Noble Hierarch and Green Sun's Zenith to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Progenitus. The deck also includes control elements such as Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to pressure opponents with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, utilizing Natural Order to cheat out powerful threats like Progenitus. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm opponents with fast, efficient threats while disrupting their plans.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a high number of artifact creatures onto the battlefield and using cards like Cranial Plating and Galvanic Blast to aggressively deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy revolves around utilizing Arcbound Ravager to sacrifice artifacts to pump up other creatures, while also using cards like Disciple of the Vault to capitalize on sacrificing artifacts. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient aggro strategy that can quickly close out games.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of disruption and efficient creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. By combining powerful disruptive spells like Force of Will and Hymn to Tourach with strong threats like Tarmogoyf and Tombstalker, the goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also presenting a clock that can quickly close out the game. The deck also includes card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent draws and maintain tempo. With a mix of disruption and aggression, this deck aims to control the game and secure a victory.

The main strategy of this Merfolk aggro deck is to use Aether Vial to quickly get creatures onto the battlefield, while also leveraging Lord of Atlantis and other tribal synergies to pump up the team. Standstill provides card advantage while forcing opponents to make difficult decisions. Counterspells like Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce help protect the board state, while Wasteland disrupts the opponent's mana base. With a combination of aggression and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp quickly into powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Progenitus using mana acceleration cards like Birds of Paradise, Noble Hierarch, and Green Sun's Zenith. The deck also utilizes cards like Natural Order and Show and Tell to cheat out these expensive threats early in the game. In addition, counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Snare help protect your creatures and disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and efficient mana ramp.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent while deploying efficient threats and finishing the game quickly. By combining disruptive elements like Hymn to Tourach, Stifle, and Wasteland with powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Tombstalker, the deck aims to gain early advantage and maintain pressure on the opponent. This strategy is further supported by card advantage engines like Brainstorm and Sylvan Library, while backup win conditions are provided by Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck is designed to be versatile, adapting to different matchups and strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, discard spells, and creature removal, while also applying pressure on the opponent with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Tombstalker. The deck aims to control the game early on with cards like Brainstorm and Stifle, while gradually building up its own board presence and card advantage with cards like Ponder and Sylvan Library. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, allowing the deck to adjust to different matchups and strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to cast multiple spells in a single turn to build up a storm count and then finish off the opponent with Tendrils of Agony. The deck aims to generate a lot of mana quickly with cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond, while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize. The deck relies on card selection and manipulation with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to find the necessary combo pieces. Ad Nauseam can be used to draw a large number of cards to fuel the storm count.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and land destruction. It aims to shut down the opponent's game plan by disrupting their hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, while also using Swords to Plowshares and Vindicate to deal with threats on the board. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Dark Confidant and Knight of the Reliquary to apply pressure and provide additional card advantage. Additionally, the inclusion of equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Umezawa's Jitte adds additional versatility and power to the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of discard spells and removal while establishing a strong board presence with efficient creatures such as Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary. The deck also aims to control the board with cards like Pernicious Deed and Vindicate, while utilizing cards like Mox Diamond and Sensei's Divining Top to generate card advantage and mana efficiency. With a balanced mix of disruption, removal, and threats, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can secure a win.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudpost and Vesuva, and then utilize Show and Tell to cheat out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and Kozilek. The deck also includes control elements like Moment's Peace and All Is Dust to protect against opponent's threats. Crop Rotation and Expedition Map help find Cloudposts and other key lands, while Candelabra of Tawnos can provide additional mana acceleration. The deck is focused on generating a large amount of mana to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and spells.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently ramp up mana using creatures like Birds of Paradise, Noble Hierarch, and Dryad Arbor to cast high-cost, powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Progenitus. The deck also utilizes cards like Natural Order and Show and Tell to cheat these big creatures into play. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive plays while also having disruption and protection through cards like Force of Will and Spell Pierce.

The main focus of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent using efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Tombstalker, backed up by disruption spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Hymn to Tourach and control the board with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Engineered Explosives. The inclusion of Pernicious Deed and Sylvan Library provides additional utility in dealing with threats and drawing cards. Overall, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of aggression and control elements.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo of Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's library. The deck includes cards like Goblin Welder and Intuition to help tutor for the pieces needed for the combo. Along with control elements like Force of Will and Pyroblast, and card draw from Brainstorm and Sensei's Divining Top, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan before eventually winning through the mill combo. The mana base includes powerful lands like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors to ramp into the combo pieces quickly.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo - Painter deck is to use Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's library and win the game quickly. The deck features cards that support this combo, such as Goblin Welder, Trinket Mage, Intuition, and Sensei's Divining Top for card selection and manipulation. Additionally, the deck includes protection with cards like Force of Will and Pyroblast/Red Elemental Blast. The mana base consists of artifact acceleration with Mox Opal and Lion's Eye Diamond, as well as lands like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors to ramp up quickly and efficiently.
